venue.address_1: Between Church, Elm, Temple and Chapel streets
venue.name: Lower New Haven Green

item.description:
This bike trip will leave from the New Haven Green. Exact meeting location will be emailed the day before the event. On the way, you will see interesting parts of New Haven such as Wooster Square, have a picnic at New Haven's only public beach, and finish with a ride on a beautifully restored carousel. Lighthouse Point Beach is located at the Eastern point of New Haven Harbor.

To learn more, go to the Park's website... http://www.cityofnewhaven.com/parks/parksinformation/lighthousepoint.asp

Or take an interactive tour... http://www.cityofnewhaven.com/parks/parksinformation/lighthouseTour.asp


At the park, we will share lunch and explore this awesome place including a pagoda and the butterfly garden. Lighthouse Point Beach is a stopping place for the Monarch Butterfly along its migration route. The carousel will also be open for a fee of 50 cents!

For info about the carousel, please visit... http://cityofnewhaven.com/Parks/ParksInformation/carousel.asp

The ride will total 13 miles roundtrip. The total time, including park exploration, will be about 3-4 hours. So expect to be back at the Green by 3 pm.

Please bring a bike lock, and your own lunch or food to share with others. The best part of biking to this beach is not having to pay the $20 entrance fee!
item.name: Bike Ride - New Haven Green to Lighthouse Point
